title: FPS issue with newest MacBook Pro with touch bar
body:
I just got a new MacBook couples weeks ago. It run the game great. Fps usually goes around between 80  to 150 with ultra high setting. However, sometimes the FPS goes extremely low like I played a 30 mins game with 20 FPS - 30 FPS entire game. Once I restart my laptop then everything goes back normal but if I keep my laptop running for couples of hours the FPS drop will happen again. 
I noticed that if the client got laggy then the game will become laggy too. I turned off switching graphic card in the system setting but there's no change.
Right now every time I start a new game I will test client around to check if client runs laggy. If client has super laggy animation then I will just restart laptop so everything goes back normal.
I am not sure this is Mac os's issue or game's issue. My friends are using Windows and they has not encounter this kind of issue ever.

replies.body: Hmmmmmm do me a favor and try turning on "low-spec mode" and "close client during game" which you can find in the client settings. Those can make the client run a little smoother, and I'm wondering if the client was what was lagging you down in game as well. Test those two out a couple times in a custom or practice match and let me know if that doesn't help at all.

Hey,  

I have the same issue. I found a fix for it. In your system Preferences set your screen resolution to the middle scaled option. I have had no issues since doing this.
